descript.abstract:
Human appropriation of net primary productivity, by terrestrial ecoregion.
We derived the map showing the amount of carbon fixed by photosynthesis and then consumed by humans from Imhoff et al. (2004a). A zonal sum procedure was applied to the gridded version of those data to summarize by ecoregion.
These data were derived by The Nature Conservancy, and were displayed in a map published in The Atlas of Global Conservation (Hoekstra et al., University of California Press, 2010). More information at http://nature.org/atlas.
Data derived from: Imhoff, M. L., L. Bounoua, T. Ricketts, C. Loucks, R. Harriss, and W. T. Lawrence. 2004a. Human Appropriation of Net Primary Productivity (HANPP). Data distributed by the Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC). Available at http://sedac.ciesin.columbia.edu/es/hanpp.html.
descript.purpose: biogeography, biodiversity conservation and priority setting.

procstep.procdesc: Consolidated Data Basin Info: Dataset copied. (\\SASQUATCH\DATA\ecoregions\version_2\WWF_terr_eco.mdb) Dataset copied. Dataset copied. Metadata imported. (D:\atlas_online\terr_metadata.xml)

attr.attrdef: Area of each individual polygon in square kilometers. The attribute area_km2 is a sum of this field for each ecoregion as a whole.
A unique number for each ecoregion within each biome nested within each realm.
This number is created by combining REALM, BIOME, and ECO_NUM, thus creating a unique numeric ID for each ecoregion.
Ecoregion Symbol - Used to display the map in ArcInfo
unique code that uses realm text, biome number and ecoregion number.
Index of human appropriation of net primary productivity, by terrestrial ecoregion.
